climate change, pollution, different types of land use change, invasive alien species and zoonoses,
and exploitation. Indirect impact drivers operate diffusely by altering and influencing direct
drivers (by affecting their level, direction or rate) as well as other indirect drivers. Interactions
between indirect and direct drivers create different chains of relationship, attribution, and
impacts, which may vary according to type, intensity, duration, and distance. These relationships
